info.description: To manage and control access to your resources, you can define customized policies and assign them at a scope.
info.title: PolicyClient

get.description: Gets all the policy assignments for a subscription.

parameters.description: The filter to apply on the operation.
parameters.name: $filter

parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

200.description: OK - Returns an array of policy assignments.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

id.description: The ID of the policy assignment.

name.description: The name of the policy assignment.

displayName.description: The display name of the policy assignment.

policyDefinitionId.description: The ID of the policy definition.

scope.description: The scope for the policy assignment.

type.description: The type of the policy assignment.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

id.description: The ID of the policy assignment.

name.description: The name of the policy assignment.

displayName.description: The display name of the policy assignment.

policyDefinitionId.description: The ID of the policy definition.

scope.description: The scope for the policy assignment.

type.description: The type of the policy assignment.

get.description: Gets all the policy definitions for a subscription.

parameters.description: The filter to apply on the operation.
parameters.name: $filter

parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

200.description: OK - Returns ana array of policy definitions.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

id.description: The ID of the policy definition.

name.description: The name of the policy definition. If you do not specify a value for name, the value is inferred from the name value in the request URI.

displayName.description: The display name of the policy definition.

policyType.description: The type of policy definition. Possible values are NotSpecified, BuiltIn, and Custom.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

parameters.name: subscriptionId

get.description: Gets policy assignments for the resource group.

parameters.description: The name of the resource group that contains policy assignments.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The filter to apply on the operation.
parameters.name: $filter

parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

200.description: OK - Returns an array of policy assignments.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

id.description: The ID of the policy assignment.

name.description: The name of the policy assignment.

get.description: Gets policy assignments for a resource.

parameters.description: The name of the resource group containing the resource. The name is case insensitive.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The namespace of the resource provider.
parameters.name: resourceProviderNamespace

parameters.description: The parent resource path.
parameters.name: parentResourcePath

parameters.description: The resource type.
parameters.name: resourceType

parameters.description: The name of the resource with policy assignments.
parameters.name: resourceName

parameters.name: $filter

parameters.name: api-version

delete.description: When providing a scope for the assignment, use '/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/' for subscriptions, '/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/resourceGroups/{resource-group-name}' for resource groups, and '/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/resourceGroups/{resource-group-name}/providers/{resource-provider-namespace}/{resource-type}/{resource-name}' for resources.

parameters.description: The ID of the policy assignment to delete. Use the format '/{scope}/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/policyAssignments/{policy-assignment-name}'.
parameters.name: policyAssignmentId

parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.
parameters.name: api-version

get.summary: Gets a policy assignment by ID.

put.description: Policy assignments are inherited by child resources. For example, when you apply a policy to a resource group that policy is assigned to all resources in the group. When providing a scope for the assignment, use '/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/' for subscriptions, '/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/resourceGroups/{resource-group-name}' for resource groups, and '/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/resourceGroups/{resource-group-name}/providers/{resource-provider-namespace}/{resource-type}/{resource-name}' for resources.

parameters.description: The ID of the policy assignment to create. Use the format '/{scope}/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/policyAssignments/{policy-assignment-name}'.
